description:
Lightweight APM dashboard for monitoring OpenTelemetry-based services.  

Instrument your applications using OpenTelemetry SDKs and send traces, metrics, and logs to Tempo for traces, a Prometheus-compatible database like Mimir for metrics, and Loki for logs. This dashboard provides a centralized view of your application's health and performance.  

For a fully managed observability stack, consider using Grafana Cloud.  

Learn more about this dashboard on https://github.com/cyrille-leclerc/opentelemetry-service-dashboard.

options.content:
Dashboard setup instructions (delete this panel after setup)

This dashboard requires: ## Metrics Send OpenTelemetry metrics to the OTLP endpoint of a Prometheus database. ### Prometheus Send OpenTelemetry metrics to the Prometheus OTLP Endpoint and configure the parameters `keep_identifying_resource_attributes` and `promote_resource_attributes` on the OTLP endpoint. Example Prometheus OTLP Endpoint configuration snippet: ```yml otlp: keep_identifying_resource_attributes: true promote_resource_attributes: # REQUIRED FOR THIS DASHBOARD - service.instance.id - service.name - service.namespace - deployment.environment.name # RECOMMENDED FOR OTEL METRICS IN GENERAL - service.version - cloud.availability_zone - cloud.region - container.name - deployment.environment - k8s.cluster.name - k8s.container.name - k8s.cronjob.name - k8s.daemonset.name - k8s.deployment.name - k8s.job.name - k8s.namespace.name - k8s.pod.name - k8s.replicaset.name - k8s.statefulset.name ``` Learn more in Prometheus [configuration reference](https://prometheus.io/docs/prometheus/latest/configuration/configuration/) and [OpenTelemetry guide](https://prometheus.io/docs/guides/opentelemetry/). ### Mimir OTLP Endpoint configuration Send OpenTelemetry metrics to the Mimir OTLP Endpoint and configure the parameters `otel_keep_identifying_resource_attributes` and `promote_otel_resource_attributes` on the OTLP endpoint. Example Mimir OTLP Endpoint configuration snippet: ```yml # (experimental) Whether to keep identifying OTel resource attributes in the # target_info metric on top of converting to job and instance labels. # CLI flag: -distributor.otel-keep-identifying-resource-attributes otel_keep_identifying_resource_attributes: true # (experimental) Optionally specify OTel resource attributes to promote to # labels. # CLI flag: -distributor.otel-promote-resource-attributes promote_otel_resource_attributes: "service.instance.id, service.name, service.namespace, service.version, cloud.availability_zone, cloud.region, container.name, deployment.environment, deployment.environment.name, k8s.cluster.name, k8s.container.name, k8s.cronjob.name, k8s.daemonset.name, k8s.deployment.name, k8s.job.name, k8s.namespace.name, k8s.pod.name, k8s.replicaset.name, k8s.statefulset.name" ``` Learn more in Mimir [configuration parameters](https://github.com/grafana/mimir/blob/main/docs/sources/mimir/configure/configuration-parameters/index.md). ### Grafana Cloud Metrics Send OpenTelemetry metrics to the Grafana Cloud OTLP Endpoint as documented in [Grafana Cloud / Send OTLP data](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana-cloud/send-data/otlp/send-data-otlp/) and open a support ticket to activate `otel_keep_identifying_resource_attributes`. Note that the Grafana Cloud OTLP Endpoint is configured by default to promote the following resource attributes, this list can be modified through a support ticket: ``` # REQUIRED FOR THIS DASHBOARD - service.instance.id - service.name - service.namespace - deployment.environment.name # RECOMMENDED FOR OTEL METRICS IN GENERAL - service.version - cloud.availability_zone - cloud.region - container.name - deployment.environment - k8s.cluster.name - k8s.container.name - k8s.cronjob.name - k8s.daemonset.name - k8s.deployment.name - k8s.job.name - k8s.namespace.name - k8s.pod.name - k8s.replicaset.name - k8s.statefulset.name ``` ## Logs ### Grafana Cloud Logs Send OpenTelemetry logs to the Grafana Cloud OTLP Endpoint as documented in [Grafana Cloud / Send OTLP data](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana-cloud/send-data/otlp/send-data-otlp/) and open a support ticket to activate `otel_keep_identifying_resource_attributes`. ### Loki Send OpenTelemetry logs to the Loki OTLP Endpoint as documented in [Loki / Send data / OpenTelemetry](https://grafana.com/docs/loki/latest/send-data/otel/). ## Traces ### Grafana Cloud Traces Send OpenTelemetry traces to the Grafana Cloud OTLP Endpoint as documented in [Grafana Cloud / Send OTLP data](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana-cloud/send-data/otlp/send-data-otlp/). ### Tempo Send OpenTelemetry traces to the Tempo OTLP Endpoint which supports both OTLP protocols: HTTP/Protobuf and gRPC. ## Grafana To prevent PromQL `rate` function issues with OpenTelemetry metrics in Grafana, either set your Prometheus Datasource's **"scrape interval"** to `60s` or, if that's not possible, configure each affected dashboard panel's **"Min Step"** option to `60s`.

panels.description: Shows the timestamp of the latest metrics received in the past 24h.

targets.expr: timestamp(sum by (deployment_environment_name, service_namespace, service_name) (target_info{deployment_environment_name=~"$deployment_environment_name", service_namespace=~"$service_namespace", service_name="$service_name"}) or absent{})

panels.title: Latest metrics received

panels.description: Shows the timestamp of the latest logs received in the past 24h.

targets.expr: sum(count_over_time({service_name="$service_name", deployment_environment_name=~"$deployment_environment_name", service_namespace=~"$service_namespace"} [5m]))

panels.title: Latest logs received

panels.description: Shows the timestamp of the latest span received in the past 24h.
panels.title: Latest traces received

panels.description:
HTTP endpoints aggregation on the `http.server.request.duration` metric.

See https://opentelemetry.io/docs/specs/semconv/http/http-metrics/#metric-httpserverrequestduration

targets.expr: histogram_quantile(0.99, sum by(le, deployment_environment_name, service_namespace, service_name) (rate(http_server_request_duration_seconds_bucket{deployment_environment_name=~"$deployment_environment_name", service_namespace=~"$service_namespace", service_name="$service_name"}[$__rate_interval])))

histogram_quantile(0.9, sum by(le, deployment_environment_name, service_namespace, service_name) (rate(http_server_request_duration_seconds_bucket{deployment_environment_name=~"$deployment_environment_name", service_namespace=~"$service_namespace", service_name="$service_name"}[$__rate_interval])))

avg by(deployment_environment_name, service_namespace, service_name) (rate(http_server_request_duration_seconds_sum{deployment_environment_name=~"$deployment_environment_name", service_namespace=~"$service_namespace", service_name="$service_name"}[$__rate_interval])) / avg by(deployment_environment_name, service_namespace, service_name) (rate(http_server_request_duration_seconds_count{deployment_environment_name=~"$deployment_environment_name", service_namespace=~"$service_namespace", service_name="$service_name"}[$__rate_interval]))

panels.title: Duration

panels.description:
HTTP endpoints aggregation on the `http.server.request.duration` metric. 

Errors are identified by   `http.response.status_code=~"5.."`.

See https://opentelemetry.io/docs/specs/semconv/http/http-metrics/#metric-httpserverrequestduration
panels.title: Error

panels.description:
HTTP endpoints aggregation on the `http.server.request.duration` metric.

See https://opentelemetry.io/docs/specs/semconv/http/http-metrics/#metric-httpserverrequestduration

targets.expr: (sum(rate(http_server_request_duration_seconds_count{deployment_environment_name=~"$deployment_environment_name", service_namespace=~"$service_namespace", service_name="$service_name"}[$__rate_interval])) by (deployment_environment_name, service_namespace, service_name))

panels.title: Request Rate

targets.expr: histogram_quantile(0.99, sum by(le, deployment_environment_name, service_namespace, service_name) (rate(rpc_server_duration_milliseconds_bucket{deployment_environment_name=~"$deployment_environment_name", service_namespace=~"$service_namespace", service_name="$service_name"}[$__rate_interval])))

histogram_quantile(0.9, sum by(le, deployment_environment_name, service_namespace, service_name) (rate(rpc_server_duration_milliseconds_bucket{deployment_environment_name=~"$deployment_environment_name", service_namespace=~"$service_namespace", service_name="$service_name"}[$__rate_interval])))

avg by(deployment_environment_name, service_namespace, service_name) (rate(rpc_server_duration_milliseconds_sum{deployment_environment_name=~"$deployment_environment_name", service_namespace=~"$service_namespace", service_name="$service_name"}[$__rate_interval])) / avg by(deployment_environment_name, service_namespace, service_name) (rate(rpc_server_duration_milliseconds_count{deployment_environment_name=~"$deployment_environment_name", service_namespace=~"$service_namespace", service_name="$service_name"}[$__rate_interval]))

panels.description:
RPC endpoints aggregation based on the `rpc.server.duration` metric.

Errors are identified by `rpc.grpc.status_code != 0` which make the panel specific to the gRPC protocol.

See https://opentelemetry.io/docs/specs/semconv/rpc/rpc-metrics/#metric-rpcserverdurationInbound
panels.title: gRPC Error

panels.description:
gRPC endpoints aggregation on the  `rpc.server.duration` metric.

See https://opentelemetry.io/docs/specs/semconv/rpc/rpc-metrics/#metric-rpcserverduration

targets.expr: (sum(rate(rpc_server_duration_milliseconds_count{deployment_environment_name=~"$deployment_environment_name", service_namespace=~"$service_namespace", service_name="$service_name"}[$__rate_interval])) by (deployment_environment_name, service_namespace, service_name)) * $__interval_ms / 1000

panels.title: Request Rate

panels.description:
Inbound HTTP operations of the service (aka HTTP endpoints) based on the `http.server.request.duration` metric.

Errors are identified by `http.response.status_code=~"5.."`.

See https://opentelemetry.io/docs/specs/semconv/http/http-metrics/#metric-httpserverrequestduration

targets.expr:
sum by (operation) (
            label_join(
                rate(http_server_request_duration_seconds_count{deployment_environment_name=~"$deployment_environment_name", service_namespace=~"$service_namespace", service_name="$service_name"}[$__rate_interval]),
                "operation",
                " ",
                "http_request_method",
                "http_route"
            )
        )

(
        sum by (operation) (
            label_join(
                rate(http_server_request_duration_seconds_count{deployment_environment_name=~"$deployment_environment_name", service_namespace=~"$service_namespace", service_name="$service_name", http_response_status_code=~"5.."}[$__rate_interval]),
                "operation",
                " ",
                "http_request_method",
                "http_route"
            )
        )
     / 
        sum by (operation) (
            label_join(
                rate(http_server_request_duration_seconds_count{deployment_environment_name=~"$deployment_environment_name", service_namespace=~"$service_namespace", service_name="$service_name"}[$__rate_interval]),
                "operation",
                " ",
                "http_request_method",
                "http_route"
            )
        )
    ) or (0 * 
        sum by (operation) (
            label_join(
                rate(http_server_request_duration_seconds_count{deployment_environment_name=~"$deployment_environment_name", service_namespace=~"$service_namespace", service_name="$service_name"}[$__rate_interval]),
                "operation",
                " ",
                "http_request_method",
                "http_route"
            )
        )
    )

histogram_quantile(
            0.99,
            sum by (le, operation) (
                label_join(
                rate(http_server_request_duration_seconds_bucket{deployment_environment_name=~"$deployment_environment_name", service_namespace=~"$service_namespace", service_name="$service_name"}[5m]),
                "operation",
                " ",
                "http_request_method",
                "http_route"
                )
            )
        )

panels.title: HTTP Operations

panels.description:
Inbound RPC operations of the service (aka RPC endpoints) based on the `rpc.server.request.duration` metric.

Errors are identified by `rpc.grpc.status_code != 0` which make the panel specific to the gRPC protocol.

https://opentelemetry.io/docs/specs/semconv/rpc/rpc-metrics/#metric-rpcserverduration

targets.expr:
sum by (operation) (
    label_join(
        rate(rpc_server_duration_milliseconds_count{deployment_environment_name=~"$deployment_environment_name", service_namespace=~"$service_namespace", service_name="$service_name"}[$__rate_interval]),
        "operation",
        "/",
        "rpc_service",
        "rpc_method"
    )
)

(
        sum by (operation) (
            label_join(
                rate(rpc_server_duration_milliseconds_count{deployment_environment_name=~"$deployment_environment_name", service_namespace=~"$service_namespace", service_name="$service_name", rpc_grpc_status_code!="0"}[$__rate_interval]),
                "operation",
                "/",
                "rpc_service",
                "rpc_method"
            )
        )
     / 
        sum by (operation) (
            label_join(
                rate(rpc_server_duration_milliseconds_count{deployment_environment_name=~"$deployment_environment_name", service_namespace=~"$service_namespace", service_name="$service_name"}[$__rate_interval]),
                "operation",
                "/",
                "rpc_service",
                "rpc_method"
            )
        )
    ) or (0 * 
        sum by (operation) (
            label_join(
                rate(rpc_server_duration_milliseconds_count{deployment_environment_name=~"$deployment_environment_name", service_namespace=~"$service_namespace", service_name="$service_name"}[$__rate_interval]),
                "operation",
                "/",
                "rpc_service",
                "rpc_method"
            )
        )
    )

histogram_quantile(
            0.99,
            sum by (le, operation) (
                label_join(
                rate(rpc_server_duration_milliseconds_bucket{deployment_environment_name=~"$deployment_environment_name", service_namespace=~"$service_namespace", service_name="$service_name"}[5m]),
                "operation",
                "/",
                "rpc_service",
                "rpc_method"
                )
            )
        )

panels.title: RPC Operations

panels.description:
HTTP calls made by the service based on the `http.client.request.duration` metric.

Calls broken done by remote `server.address` and by `http.request.method`.

See https://opentelemetry.io/docs/specs/semconv/http/http-metrics/#metric-httpclientrequestduration

targets.expr:
(
  sum by (outbound_service) (
    label_join(
      rate(
        http_client_request_duration_seconds_count{
          deployment_environment_name=~"$deployment_environment_name",
          service_namespace=~"$service_namespace",
          service_name="$service_name",
          http_response_status_code=~"5.."
        }[$__rate_interval]
      ),
      "outbound_service",
      " ",
      "server_address",
      "http_request_method",
      "url_template"
    )
  )
  /
  sum by (outbound_service) (
    label_join(
      rate(
        http_client_request_duration_seconds_count{
          deployment_environment_name=~"$deployment_environment_name",
          service_namespace=~"$service_namespace",
          service_name="$service_name"
        }[$__rate_interval]
      ),
      "outbound_service",
      " ",
      "server_address",
      "http_request_method",
      "url_template"
    )
  )
)
or
(
  0
  *
  sum by (outbound_service) (
    label_join(
      rate(
        http_client_request_duration_seconds_count{
          deployment_environment_name=~"$deployment_environment_name",
          service_namespace=~"$service_namespace",
          service_name="$service_name"
        }[$__rate_interval]
      ),
      "outbound_service",
      " ",
      "server_address",
      "http_request_method",
      "url_template"
    )
  )
)

panels.title: Outbound HTTP Services

panels.description:
DB calls made by the service based on the `db.client.operation.duration` metric.

Calls broken down by `server.address` and `db.namespace`.

See https://opentelemetry.io/docs/specs/semconv/database/database-metrics/#metric-dbclientoperationduration

targets.expr:
(
        sum by (database) (
            label_join(
                rate(db_client_operation_duration_seconds_count{deployment_environment_name=~"$deployment_environment_name", service_namespace=~"$service_namespace", service_name="$service_name", http_response_status_code=~"5.."}[$__rate_interval]),
                "database",
                "/",
                "server_address",
                "db_namespace"
            )
        )
     / 
        sum by (database) (
            label_join(
                rate(db_client_operation_duration_seconds_count{deployment_environment_name=~"$deployment_environment_name", service_namespace=~"$service_namespace", service_name="$service_name"}[$__rate_interval]),
                "database",
                "/",
                "server_address",
                "db_namespace"
            )
        )
    ) or (0 * 
        sum by (database) (
            label_join(
                rate(db_client_operation_duration_seconds_count{deployment_environment_name=~"$deployment_environment_name", service_namespace=~"$service_namespace", service_name="$service_name"}[$__rate_interval]),
                "database",
                "/",
                "server_address",
                "db_namespace"
            )
        )
    )

panels.title: Outbound Databases

panels.description:
RPC calls made by the service based on the `rpc.client.request.duration` metric.

Specific to gRPC due to the usage of the `grpc.status.code` attribute to identify errors.

Calls broken down by `server.address`, `rpc.service`, and `rpc.method`.

See https://opentelemetry.io/docs/specs/semconv/rpc/rpc-metrics/#rpc-client

targets.expr:
sum by (outbound_service) (
            label_join(
                rate(rpc_client_duration_milliseconds_count{deployment_environment_name=~"$deployment_environment_name", service_namespace=~"$service_namespace", service_name="$service_name"}[$__rate_interval]),
                "outbound_service",
                "/",
                "server_address",
                "rpc_service",
                "rpc_method"
            )
        )

(
        sum by (outbound_service) (
            label_join(
                rate(rpc_client_duration_milliseconds_count{deployment_environment_name=~"$deployment_environment_name", service_namespace=~"$service_namespace", service_name="$service_name", http_response_status_code=~"5.."}[$__rate_interval]),
                "outbound_service",
                "/",
                "server_address",
                "rpc_service",
                "rpc_method"
            )
        )
     / 
        sum by (outbound_service) (
            label_join(
                rate(rpc_client_duration_milliseconds_count{deployment_environment_name=~"$deployment_environment_name", service_namespace=~"$service_namespace", service_name="$service_name"}[$__rate_interval]),
                "outbound_service",
                "/",
                "server_address",
                "rpc_service",
                "rpc_method"
            )
        )
    ) or (0 * 
        sum by (outbound_service) (
            label_join(
                rate(rpc_client_duration_milliseconds_count{deployment_environment_name=~"$deployment_environment_name", service_namespace=~"$service_namespace", service_name="$service_name"}[$__rate_interval]),
                "outbound_service",
                "/",
                "server_address",
                "rpc_service",
                "rpc_method"
            )
        )
    )

histogram_quantile(
    0.99,
    sum by (le, outbound_service) (
        label_join(
        rate(rpc_client_duration_milliseconds_bucket{deployment_environment_name=~"$deployment_environment_name", service_namespace=~"$service_namespace", service_name="$service_name"}[5m]),
        "outbound_service",
        "/",
        "server_address",
        "rpc_service",
        "rpc_method"
        )
    )
)

panels.title: Outbound RPC Services

panels.description:
Logs of the service, filtered by `service.name` and `service.namespace`.

To explore the logs, open the menu clicking on the icon `` of this panel and click on `Explore`.

targets.expr: {deployment_environment_name=~"$deployment_environment_name", service_namespace=~"$service_namespace", service_name="$service_name"} | line_format `[1m{{if .level }}{{alignRight 5 .level}}{{else if .severity_text}}{{alignRight 5 .severity_text}}{{end}}[0m [90m[{{alignRight 10 .service_instance_id}}{{if .thread_name}}/{{alignRight 20 .thread_name}}{{else if eq "java" .telemetry_sdk_language }}                    {{end}}][0m [36m{{if .scope_name }}{{alignRight 40 .scope_name}}{{end}}{{if .exception_type}} [1;101m [0m{{end}} {{if .exception_type}}[1;91m{{.exception_type}}[0m{{end}}{{if .exception_message}} [1;91m{{.exception_message}}[0m {{end}} [0m {{__line__}} {{if .trace_id}} [37m[3m[trace_id={{.trace_id}}]{{end}}`

panels.description: Traces containing a span emitted by the service

For JVM based services like Java or Kotlin, the JVM metrics.

See https://opentelemetry.io/docs/specs/semconv/runtime/jvm-metrics/

targets.expr: sum by(service_instance_id) (jvm_cpu_recent_utilization_ratio{deployment_environment_name=~"$deployment_environment_name", service_namespace=~"$service_namespace", service_name="$service_name"})

sum by(service_instance_id) (rate(jvm_gc_duration_seconds_sum{deployment_environment_name=~"$deployment_environment_name", service_namespace=~"$service_namespace", service_name="$service_name"}[$__rate_interval]))

panels.title: JVM

list.description:
OpenTelemetry metrics. 
Send metrics using the Prometheus OTLP endpoint activating `keep_identifying_resource_attributes` and resource attribute promotion (aka `promote_resource_attributes`) including `service.name`, service.namespace`, `service.instance.id`, and `deployment.environment.name`
list.label: Metrics
list.name: prometheus_datasource

list.description:
OpenTelemetry logs.

Send logs using the Loki OTLP endpoint activating resource attribute promotion (aka `default_resource_attributes_as_index_labels`) including `service.name`, service.namespace`, and `deployment.environment.name`
list.label: Logs
list.name: loki_datasource

title: Lightweight APM for OpenTelemetry
